A Buckingham Palace guard slipped and fell during the Changing of the Guard, knocking his bearskin and dropping his rifle. The incident was captured on camera by a tourist, David Meadwell, and the guard appeared embarrassed after realizing many people had witnessed the fall. The guard is believed to have slipped due to metal protectors nailed to the soles of his boots. The Guard, under the command of the Captain of The Queen's Guard, is not purely ceremonial but fully operational soldiers. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident.

The passage discusses the remake of the miniseries "Roots," an epic about an African-American slave and his descendants, which originally aired in 1977 and had over 100 million viewers. The remake, set to air in 2016, will be simulcast on A&E, Lifetime, and History networks. LeVar Burton, who played the lead role in the original, will co-executive produce the new miniseries. The remake will be more faithful to Alex Haley's novel, "Roots: The Saga of an American Family," and will consult scholars in African and African-American history for added authenticity. The remake is described as "original" and "contemporary." The new version will be released in a time when the nation has witnessed Barack Obama as the first African-American president, the Oscar-winning film "12 Years a Slave," and widespread racial unrest over police treatment of black suspects in many U.S. cities. A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, has accused Clarence House aides of trying to force him into an orgy in 1978. He was 27 at the time and working at Clarence House, which was the Queen Mother's London residence. Lawler claims he was accosted by four men, one of whom was a senior member of staff, after he entered a bedroom to find a pen. He was groped, threatened, and attempted to be undressed, but managed to escape. Lawler initially made a complaint the same day, but it was ignored for months. He was later contacted by the Palace after investigations into historical child abuse cases began, but his complaints were again rebuffed twice. Months later, his complaint was finally passed to Scotland Yard. A retired royal aide, now in his 80s, was interviewed but denied involvement as he was working for the Queen in Balmoral at the time. The Palace has since stated they will cooperate with any police investigation. The police have not commented further as investigations continue.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to the theme from '90s television sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air'. The video, which has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, was made to share the news with loved ones living far away. The Meeks, who are expecting their third child, parodied the original song's lyrics, detailing their journey to conceive and the surprise of Melissa's pregnancy. The video includes a sonogram of their unborn child. Jesse is the great-great-grandson of Oregon pioneer Joseph Lafayette Meek. Melissa earlier made a video capturing Jesse's reaction when he found out about the pregnancy. A similar pregnancy announcement video using 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air' theme song was made by a couple from Phoenixville, Pennsylvania, last year.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in the 1939 film Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction. The dress, originally slate blue-gray, has faded to light gray over the years. It was part of a collection of over 150 items from the film, owned by James Tumblin, who bought it for $20 in the 1960s. Other top-selling items included a hat worn by Leigh for $52,500, trousers and a jacket worn by Clark Gable for $55,000, and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland for $30,000. The film, based on Margaret Mitchell's 1936 best-selling book, celebrated its 75th anniversary last year. Hattie McDaniel, who played Scarlett's nanny Mammy, became the first African-American actor to be nominated for and win an Academy Award.

A two-year-old boy fell approximately 10-12 feet into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. The child was rescued by his parents before emergency services arrived. He sustained minor bumps and bruises and was listed in stable condition at the hospital. The boy's leg was injured in the fall, but he was not attacked by the cheetahs. Witnesses reported hearing the child scream and expressed shock and disbelief at the parents' actions. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family, and the exhibit was closed following the incident.

A speed camera, previously enforcing a 30mph speed limit in Handsworth, Birmingham, has been angled towards a private residence on Wellington Road. The camera has not been functioning for two years as all fixed devices were decommissioned across the West Midlands in 2013 due to outdated technology. Mobile camera units, fixed cameras on motorways, and traffic officers on patrol have taken over speed enforcement in the region. The exact party responsible for re-pointing the camera remains unknown, but Birmingham City Council is aware of the situation and will send an engineer to the site to potentially remove the camera. The owners of the house were not available for comment, and there are no plans to include the camera in Wellington Road in the new pilot using digital technology.

Usain Bolt, a six-time Olympic gold medalist, has confirmed his participation in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month as part of the Jamaican team. Bolt expressed his readiness to compete, stating that he is fit and healthy. He also mentioned his enthusiasm for the event, citing the fun atmosphere and Jamaica's successful tradition in relays. The full Jamaican team list for the competition will be announced soon. Bolt consistently aims to make his country proud while representing Jamaica.

In the provided passage, it is stated that Neymar and Dani Alves, team-mates on Barcelona's football team, showed their support for the club's basketball side by attending a Euro League contest. The basketball match, El Clasico, was between Barcelona and Real Madrid, with Barcelona winning narrowly (85-80). Despite this victory, Real Madrid remains at the top of their Euro League division due to a better points difference.

Neymar, who is also the captain of Brazil, helped his national team secure a 1-0 win over Chile in a feisty match at the Emirates Stadium. During the match, Neymar was subjected to several rough challenges, including one from Gary Medel who was sent off for appearing to stamp on Neymar.

Neymar's sister, Rafaella, accompanied him to watch both the basketball match and the football match against Real Madrid. The passage also mentions that Neymar and Dani Alves, along with some friends, watched a live basketball match together.

In the future, Neymar and his Barcelona team-mates will return to La Liga to play Celta V

In the provided passage, Italy is experiencing a surge of migrants from Africa and the Middle East aiming to reach Europe. From April 3 to 6, a total of 8,480 migrants were rescued by the Italian coast guard, with 20 boats in distress reported on Monday alone. Save the Children fears that around 400 migrants could be missing, based on survivor testimonies about a capsized ship carrying 550 people approximately 80 miles off the Libyan coast. However, the Italian coast guard has not confirmed this incident and has not found any evidence to support it. The International Organization for Migration (IOM) reports that most migrants this year come from West African countries, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit country. Since the beginning of the year, at least 480 migrants have died while crossing the Mediterranean, often due to bad weather, overcrowded vessels, and abandonment by smugglers. Last week, 978 migrants were rescued in a single day in the Mediterranean Sea.

Alexis Sanchez, a Chilean forward, chose to join Arsenal over Liverpool after being courted by several elite clubs. Sanchez has made an immediate impact at Arsenal, scoring 19 goals this season. Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger believes Sanchez's quick adaptation and high-quality play make him one of the best around. Wenger also acknowledges that Liverpool's interest in Sanchez may have been used as leverage during negotiations for Luis Suarez's move to Barcelona. Regarding Liverpool, Wenger praises manager Brendan Rodgers for his team's performance, particularly their goal-scoring ability, despite losing key players like Suarez and Sturridge. Wenger has also downplayed speculation linking him with a potential summer transfer for Liverpool forward Raheem Sterling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner, plans to break the cycling hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. He aims to ride the furthest distance in 60 minutes, surpassing the current record of 52.491km set by Australian Rohan Dennis. Wiggins will attempt to motivate people to challenge themselves and will set a mark that is expected to last for some time. The event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports, and tickets will be available from April 19. Wiggins will also participate in the inaugural Tour de Yorkshire before preparing for the Hour record attempt. Alex Dowsett, another British cyclist, will attempt to break the record earlier in May.

Serena Williams, a two-time French Open champion and current world No. 1, faced Sara Errani in the Fed Cup play-off on Sunday. Despite Williams' power, Errani gave her a tough match, but Williams eventually won 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3. However, the US team was relegated to World Group II due to a doubles defeat by Errani and Flavia Pennetta. Williams admitted that the match was an 'eye-opener' and she is not as ready for the claycourt season as she thought. She plans to adjust her playstyle to suit the clay court. Williams has won 19 singles grand slams, but her performance in the French Open has been less successful. The US team will need to work harder to return to the elite nations next year.

The passage discusses the interest of River Plate in signing Radamel Falcao, a striker currently on loan at Manchester United. Falcao previously played for River Plate for four seasons, scoring 34 goals in 90 appearances. River Plate's vice president, Matias Patanian, has expressed the club's desire to bring Falcao back, stating that "the doors are open." However, Falcao's future at Manchester United is uncertain, as he has struggled to score goals this season and it is not yet known whether United will exercise the option to keep him or if he will return to his parent club, Monaco. Falcao has recently been in good form for Colombia, scoring three goals in two games to equal Colombia's all-time goalscoring record with 24 goals.

Ella Henderson, a pop star who gained fame on The X Factor in 2012, has been announced as the official face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign. This is her first brand collaboration. The campaign features Henderson with various hairstyles, including her long hair styled into a half-pony, and she is pictured wearing a black lacy dress with sheer panels. The partnership between Henderson and Batiste was facilitated by the MILES agency, and the international campaign launched with a TV advertising campaign featuring Henderson's latest single, Mirror Man. Henderson uses Batiste's dry shampoo regularly and is excited about the collaboration. The CEO of Crown Talent & Media Group, who manage Ella, is looking forward to a successful 2015.

A man named Aaron Siler was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres in Kenosha, Wisconsin on March 14. Siler was wanted on an active felony probation and parole warrant and was shot after a vehicle and foot pursuit. The shooting occurred 10 days after Torres shot a 66-year-old man named Terry Knight, who was armed with two knives. The investigation into Knight's shooting was turned over to the District Attorney and determined to be justified. A billboard featuring Torres and his dog was erected by the Kenosha Professional Police Association, which was met with criticism from Siler's family and friends who found it disrespectful. The police association claims that the billboard was simply to thank the community for its support. The investigation into Siler's death is still ongoing.

In a clash near the Iran-Pakistan border, eight Iranian border guards were killed by militants from the group Jaish al Adal. The militants crossed into Iran from Pakistan, according to Iranian officials. Jaish al Adal is an anti-Iranian group that has emerged in the restive Pakistani province of Balochistan and has targeted Shiites, aiming to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan. Iran has criticized Pakistan for not controlling the terrorists. Pakistan condemned the attack as an act of terrorism and promised to apprehend the militants if they enter Pakistan.

The passage discusses a political conversation in Japan's parliament (Diet) about the existence of extraterrestrial unidentified flying objects (UFOs). The Defense Minister, Gen Nakatani, stated that the Japanese Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) has never encountered any UFOs from outer space. The conversation was initiated by Antonio Inoki, a former wrestler-turned-lawmaker, who is known for his political achievements and claims to have seen a UFO. Inoki also questioned if aircraft were ever scrambled to meet extraterrestrial threats, and if research was being done into alien visitors. This is not the first time Japanese politicians have discussed the implications of visitors from another planet, as in 2007, then-Defense Minister Shigeru Ishiba pondered the legal ramifications of a defense against an invasion from outer space.

A passenger named Jin Pai, 35, was hospitalized with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks after he broke a toilet he was squatting on in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport, Hefei, China. The incident occurred because he was concerned about the cleanliness of the seat and decided to stand on the rim of the toilet. The toilet then tipped over and shattered, causing his injuries. The man received several dozen stitches in a Hefei hospital. He initially confessed to his friends that he was squatting on the toilet, but later changed his story to the police, possibly to avoid paying compensation. Authorities believe the incident was an accident and remind people that toilets are for sitting, not standing.

Kevin Rebbie, a 56-year-old resident of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a 15-year-old girl over a four-year period and filming her, as well as others, with a hidden camera in a bathroom. The abuse included molestation and recording while the girl was undressing and showering. The investigation began when the girl found the hidden camera in her bathroom in March. Rebbie faces several charges, including aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy. He admitted to filming several victims, including the 15-year-old girl, and had purchased the camera specifically for this purpose. His preliminary hearing is scheduled for May 1, and he is currently being held on a $500,000 bail. The relationship between Rebbie and the girl's family is unknown.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama has created a series of photographs for his book, roughly titled "Daughter and Salary Man." In these images, fathers are depicted leaping into the air next to their daughters, while the daughters maintain a serious expression and smile at the camera. The fathers wear sharp suits, and the daughters wear casual clothing. The photographs were taken at various Japanese landmarks, and some fathers appear to struggle with their energetic leaps, showing slight signs of discomfort. The photographs have generated significant online interest due to their unusual nature.

The passage discusses the start of the county championship season in English cricket, with a focus on Kevin Pietersen's participation with Surrey. Pietersen, who was controversially axed from the England team in 2014, is aiming to return to the international set-up following the dismissal of Paul Downton as England's managing director. Pietersen was seen in deep thought during a team photo shoot at the KIA Oval, but was otherwise jovial. He is set to play for Surrey against Oxford MCCU on Sunday, and the team is scheduled to begin their county championship season at Glamorgan on April 19. Pietersen was seen joking with photographers and team-mates during the photo shoot, and was all smiles ahead of the new season. The passage also mentions that Pietersen took pictures of photographers using his camera during the event.

Romanian football club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt has dismissed coach Ze Maria for the second time within a week, following a poor performance against FC Botosani that left the team 16th in the standings, six points from safety. Ze Maria, a former Inter Milan and Parma defender who represented Brazil 25 times, was initially reinstated after being fired earlier in the week, but his second dismissal was due to another loss. The club will be led by Serbian coach Vanya Radinovic moving forward.

Radamel Falcao, a former striker for Monaco, went on a season-long loan to Manchester United last summer. However, he has struggled to perform at the level he did before a serious knee injury, scoring only four goals all season. Manchester United may have to pay £46million to make Falcao's transfer permanent, but given his performance, it is unlikely they will exercise this option. Falcao's former team-mate, Nabil Dirar, believes Falcao would have been better off staying at Monaco, as he was not happy in France. Dirar suggests that Falcao may have needed a more lively atmosphere to thrive.

A man wearing a distinctive cartoon mask robbed a dairy in Christchurch, New Zealand, making off with the cash register and approximately $1500. The offender is described as very tall and was wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt. The incident occurred on Saturday at the Union St dairy, and the police were called after receiving reports of a masked man demanding cash from the dairy owner's daughter. The robber remains at large, and the police are asking for the public's help in identifying him. Anyone with information is encouraged to contact Crimestoppers or message the police online.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, was arrested twice in March. The first arrest was on March 19 for an inappropriate relationship with a 15-year-old student, which allegedly included kissing and allowing the student to touch her breasts. She was released on bail. A second arrest followed on March 24, after another 15-year-old student accused Granado of having sex with him on two consecutive nights in January. The sexual encounters are said to have taken place in her car near another school in Dallas. Granado was booked into Irving County Jail for the second time and released after posting a $50,000 bail. It is not known how she intends to plead to the second set of charges. She remains on administrative leave from the school district, preventing her from working with students or being present on any school property.

A menacing crocodile was filmed swimming through a public marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead pet dog in its mouth. The dog belonged to the local bike shop's owner. The incident was witnessed by New Zealander Tim Weston, who described the crocodile keeping the dog in its mouth for hours. The video of the incident has been viewed over 500,000 times online. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta, a Mexican beach resort built amongst mangroves, and are also found in a nearby sanctuary and on the resort's golf course. Some social media users have expressed horror and dislike towards crocodiles following the incident. The American Crocodiles in Mexico can reach lengths of 6 meters and are living closer to humans due to urbanization.

Steve Bruce, Hull City manager, is determined to keep the team in the Barclays Premier League despite a 2-0 defeat by Southampton, which left them in a relegation battle. Hull had targeted 10 wins to survive, but have managed only six. They are currently just two points clear of the drop zone. Bruce believes they might need nine or eight wins in their remaining six games, which include tough fixtures against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham, and Manchester United.

Bruce attributes Hull's struggles to several long-term injuries to key players, such as Mohamed Diame, James Chester, Michael Dawson, Nikica Jelavic, and Robert Snodgrass. He believes these injuries have made it difficult for Hull to cope and perform at their best.

Southampton, on the other hand, moved up to fifth place in the table after the match, with James Ward-Prowse scoring a penalty and Graziano Pelle adding a late goal. However, manager Ronald Koeman had to intervene when Sadio Mane tried to take a penalty, which was not his designated role. Koeman plans to address

A teacher named Ian Guffick has been banned from the classroom for at least two years due to his actions that led to the annulment of Mitton Manor Primary School's SATs results for the year 2014. Guffick was found to have asked pupils to change their SATs exam answers, and he also made changes himself, after the exam session had finished. This breach of exam rules led to an investigation by the local education authority, which found that some pupils had changed answers outside exam conditions, and Guffick had done the same. The Department for Education then annulled the school's SATs results. Guffick admitted to the allegations and accepted it amounted to unacceptable professional conduct. However, he claimed that he only asked pupils to make their answers more legible, not to change them. The panel found that no changes of any kind should be made to exam scripts outside test conditions. Guffick was given 28 days to appeal the decision in the High Court.

Anders Lindegaard, a goalkeeper for Manchester United, has been enjoying time off the pitch with his wife Misse Beqiri, a Swedish model with Albanian roots. They married in a beach wedding in Mauritius last year and have a son together. Lindegaard has struggled for playing time at Manchester United, making only 19 league appearances in five seasons, and is currently third-choice at Old Trafford. Despite his limited playing time, he has been active on Instagram, sharing photos with his wife. Beqiri, who has over 17,000 followers on Instagram, regularly posts modeling photos. Lindegaard was linked with a move to FC Midtjylland in January, but the two clubs could not agree on a price.

The passage describes an unsuccessful auction of glowing blue letters that once adorned Yankee Stadium in the Bronx. The letters, which were expected to sell for between $300,000 and $600,000, failed to find a buyer. The current owner of the letters is Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased them after the stadium's final game in 2008. Jackson attended the auction at Sotheby's but did not bid. The letters had been installed in 1976 and were taken down in 2008. Additionally, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 60s was auctioned off separately, and it sold for $112,500, despite being estimated at only $20,000 to $30,000.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has addressed the off-field behavior of Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, reminding them of their professional responsibilities after pictures emerged of them with shisha pipes. Neither player will be disciplined, but Rodgers wants to draw a line under the matter. He emphasized the importance of understanding the expectations and responsibilities that come with being a professional athlete. Rodgers also mentioned that captain Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa after serving a three-match suspension, but he has not revealed whether he will recall Gerrard for the game. Rodgers believes that the team is ready to progress in the FA Cup, having come close but falling short in the title race and the Capital One Cup last season. He emphasized that losing is part of the journey and can help improve players and teams.

Mesut Ozil, Arsenal's playmaker, returned home from the international break and posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog. He was in good form during Germany's 2-0 win against Georgia in a Euro 2016 qualifier. Ozil missed Arsenal's last game against Newcastle due to illness but is expected to play against Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium. He has been performing well for Arsenal since returning from injury, with four assists and three goals since January. Ozil claims he is adjusting well to English football and enjoys the demanding schedule, stating that he fits in 'perfectly'.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu has stated that the club is content with manager Luis Enrique's performance, despite speculation about his potential replacement. Enrique, who took charge last summer and signed a two-year deal, is six games away from winning the La Liga title. His side, Barcelona, comfortably defeated Valencia in their recent match, with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi. Enrique's contract runs until 2016, and Bartomeu suggests that discussions about a new contract will take place in the future.

Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract, worth approximately £100,000-a-week, running until 2020. Henderson, who joined Liverpool in 2011 for £16million, has been one of the most improved players under manager Brendan Rodgers. His form this season has resulted in 13 assists and 7 goals from midfield. Henderson is expected to be considered for the role of club captain when Steven Gerrard moves to LA Galaxy. Talks with Raheem Sterling, another key player, are expected to resume at the end of the season.

Filipe Luis, a full back currently at Chelsea, has expressed his desire to stay at the club until the end of his contract, despite Atletico Madrid considering re-signing him. Luis signed a three-year contract last July but has found it challenging to secure the left back position at Stamford Bridge. Chelsea is currently leading the Premier League, and manager Jose Mourinho is urging the team to maintain focus and win every game to secure the title. Filipe Luis recently played for Brazil during the international break against France and Chile, but his focus is now back on the Premier League title run-in.

Nathan Hughes, a Fiji-born player for Wasps, had his three-match ban for accidentally knocking out George North during a match on March 27 overturned on appeal. The incident occurred as Hughes scored a try for Northampton, and North was left unconscious on the pitch and advised to take a month off from playing due to concussion symptoms. Hughes missed Wasps' Champions Cup quarter-final loss against Toulon while awaiting his appeal hearing. The appeal panel concluded that the incident was accidental, and Hughes is now free to return to action immediately, but he is not in the match-day squad for Wasps' Aviva Premiership trip to London Welsh tomorrow. Many, including former England players, spoke up in defense of Hughes, expressing dismay over the initial suspension.

The passage describes a series of intense, reddish sunsets observed in the Pacific Northwest, specifically in parts of Washington, Oregon, and British Columbia. These sunsets are attributed to wildfires in southeastern Siberia, which were likely started by farmers burning grass in their fields. The fires grew out of control due to strong winds, destroying dozens of villages in the region. The smoke from these fires was carried across the Pacific Ocean by atmospheric winds, resulting in the reddish sunsets seen in the Pacific Northwest. The smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors like greens, blues, yellows, and purples, allowing red and orange colors to penetrate the air unfiltered. As the smoke dissipates, air quality will improve, and the fiery sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

A Missouri woman, Becky Schoenig, had her brand new 2015 Ford Fusion stolen from her driveway in St. Louis. After being found and returned, the car had been modified with red rims, red detailing, and orange steering wheel accents. Instead of being upset, Schoenig thanked the thieves for the modifications and posted about her new car on Facebook. She is now getting the vehicle professionally cleaned and is creating a smoothie named 'The Sexton on Wheels' at her restaurant, The Hot Pot, to honor Mick Sexton, the man who found her car and notified police. The car had a strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana.

Manchester City players, including Sergio Aguero, David Silva, Joe Hart, Yaya Toure, and others, stand to lose £500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. This is due to incentivized contracts aimed at maintaining financial fair play within the club. After a recent loss to Manchester United, City is currently in fourth place, four points ahead of Liverpool. The top three teams in the Premier League automatically qualify for the Champions League, while the fourth-place team must win a qualifying round to join them. The City squad collectively has around £12 million at stake in reaching their European target. City manager Manuel Pellegrini has acknowledged the team's poor performance in the last three months and expressed the need for improvement. Meanwhile, Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal is optimistic about signing top-class players like Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba in the next transfer window.

In the'mini-derby', Manchester United's Under 18s defeated City's Under 18s 1-0. The match was played at Altrincham's home, a 6,000-capacity stadium, and was free for spectators. The majority of the players were English, with 10 being Mancunian. Callum Gribbin, an England Under 17 star, scored the winning goal with a free-kick. Marcus Rashford, another local talent, had chances for United but failed to convert. City had opportunities to equalize but were unsuccessful. The result leaves United two points behind leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand. The match showcased promising talent on both sides that may deserve first-team opportunities in the future.

England goalkeeper Joe Hart, who recently represented his country for the 50th time, praised fellow goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon as a 'legend of the game' after witnessing Buffon claim his 147th cap. Hart, who plays for Manchester City, expressed admiration for Buffon's professionalism at the age of 37 and revealed his desire to continue learning from him. Hart also expressed his delight at receiving his 50th cap and expressed his ambition to add more international caps to his tally.

Mexican restaurant chain Chipotle has entered the $70 billion food delivery market by partnering with the Postmates app. This collaboration will allow Chipotle to offer delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities. A service charge of 9% will be added to orders, with delivery fees starting at $5 and varying based on distance and demand. Chipotle has previously declined offers to collaborate with third-party delivery services. The app uses independent contractors for delivery, similar to Uber taxis. Notable customers of Chipotle include presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Marco Rubio. Other franchises, such as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King, are also exploring delivery options.

The passage discusses the plea made by the parents of Martin Richard, the youngest victim of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, to the Justice Department to remove the death penalty from the sentencing of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the man convicted for the bombings. The Richards, who lost their 8-year-old son and had their 7-year-old daughter severely injured, have expressed their desire for Tsarnaev to spend the rest of his life in prison without the possibility of release and to waive all his rights to appeal. They believe that the continued pursuit of the death penalty could prolong reliving the painful day of the bombings and cause their remaining children to grow up with a lingering reminder of their loss. The sentencing phase for Tsarnaev is expected to begin on the day after this year's Boston Marathon, and it is expected to last four weeks.

The passage describes a custom-built Boeing 747-8, valued at approximately £400 million, that has been converted into a luxury home for an unnamed billionaire. The aircraft, which typically carries up to 600 passengers, has been redesigned to accommodate a single owner and several guests. The interior features multiple lounges, a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, a conference room, a master bedroom, and an aeroloft with eight beds. The decor is luxurious and hotel-like, with plush furniture, porthole-style windows, and over-the-top decorations. The aircraft also includes a restaurant and spaces for guests to relax while watching television. The layout of the plane is shown in a plan published by Greenpoint Technologies. The luxury interior has been built inside a Boeing 747-8, which can hold up to 600 passengers.

SpaceX launched an uncrewed cargo spacecraft called Dragon towards the International Space Station using a Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral, Florida. However, the attempt to land the rocket stage on a floating barge for the first time was unsuccessful, as it tipped over. The rocket's smaller top part will carry the Dragon into orbit and then burn up in Earth's atmosphere. The Dragon will deliver over 4,300 pounds of supplies, including research equipment and an espresso maker, to the space station. After the crew unpacks the supplies, they will fill the Dragon with over 3,000 pounds of science experiments, trash, and other items to send back to Earth. The Dragon will then leave the space station and splashdown in the Pacific Ocean off California. This is the sixth SpaceX mission to the International Space Station, and SpaceX was the first private space contractor to dock with the station. The launch was the second attempt for this mission, as the first attempt was scrubbed due to weather.

Priscilla Presley, Elvis Presley's former wife, will serve as a witness at the first wedding to take place at a new Elvis Presley-themed chapel in Las Vegas, located inside the Westgate Hotel. The winning couple of a contest hosted by Priscilla and NBC's Today show will receive a free wedding, reception, hotel suite for two nights, airfare, and concert tickets. The chapel is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit of Elvis Presley's artifacts outside his Memphis, Tennessee home. Couples interested in winning this opportunity must submit a video or photos explaining why they deserve the prize. The chapel will not allow Elvis impersonators. The winning couple will be announced on Monday, April 23, and the wedding will take place on the same day.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson believes his team can catch Manchester City in the Premier League, having played their 47th game of the season in a 2-0 win over Newcastle United. Raheem Sterling and Joe Allen scored the goals for Liverpool, with Allen securing a two-goal cushion. Newcastle had a potential penalty claim denied, and Liverpool are four points behind Manchester City in the race for the Champions League. Allen admitted he thought a penalty should have been given to Newcastle in a previous game.

In the Serie A match between Roma and Napoli, Roma ended their four-month winless streak at home with a 1-0 victory. Miralem Pjanic scored the only goal in the 25th minute after a counter-attack. Goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis was instrumental in the win, saving multiple shots by Napoli in the second half. Roma moved provisionally four points ahead of city rivals Lazio, while Napoli's winless streak was extended to five matches. The match was under tight security due to past incidents, but there were no reported problems. Roma was without injured captain Francesco Totti and fellow forward Gervinho, but Pjanic made an impact with a free kick and the assist for the goal. Napoli may have had a case for a penalty in the first half, but there was little protest. Roma's goalkeeper, Morgan de Sanctis, was particularly impressive in the second half, denying several shots from Napoli's Dries Mertens and Manolo Gabbiadini. Roma's Juan Iturbe had a chance to make it 2-0 late in the game, but his shot hit the outside

The passage discusses the football match between Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town in League One, which ended in a 0-0 draw. The match was uneventful and uninspiring, with neither team scoring. The Doncaster Rovers media team had a difficult time compiling match highlights due to the lack of action, and thus created a very short, 27-second video featuring only the kick-off, a goal kick, and the final whistle. This video was described as a must-see for all football fans.

The passage describes a unique relationship between a man, Roland Giroux, and his blood parrot cichlid fish. The man interacts with the fish by giving it a massage within the fish tank, which the fish appears to enjoy. The fish initially moves away but returns to be stroked multiple times. The man also feeds the fish frozen blood worms by hand and noticed it becoming more sociable. The fish follows the man's hand when he removes it from the tank, suggesting a strong bond between them. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid fish first bred in Taiwan in 1986. The man removes two other fish from the tank when they were bullying his prized pet, and he spends at least 15 minutes each day massaging and playing with the fish. The man shares videos of his interactions with the fish on his YouTube channel.

Ben Stokes, a fiery and exuberant player in the England cricket team, has returned to the team after a year of ups and downs. He is known for his aggressive behavior, such as punching a locker after being dismissed last year, but has learned to control this aggression following advice from coach Peter Moores. Stokes' natural exuberance and desire to compete should be encouraged, but his aggression must be controlled to ensure productive results in the form of runs and wickets. England aims to have Stokes in the team as much as possible to help him reach his full potential, and they may consider playing a second spinner, Adil Rashid, but want both Stokes and Chris Jordan to play as much as possible this summer.

The passage discusses the upcoming Euro 2016 qualifier between Wales and Belgium, which has been declared a 33,000 sell-out at the Cardiff City Stadium. This match is significant as it is Wales' best opportunity to qualify for a major tournament since the 1958 World Cup finals. Both teams have 11 points from five games, but Belgium, ranked fourth in the world, leads due to a superior goal difference. The match has generated high expectations, particularly after Wales' 3-0 victory over Israel, which took them to the top of Group B on goal difference. The Football Association of Wales has been overwhelmed with ticket requests, causing general admission tickets to sell out. The Welsh squad prefers to play at the Cardiff City Stadium rather than the Millennium Stadium, and the venue change was not possible due to UEFA rules.

The UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria will take place next month, with England as the defending champions. The Young Lions, coached by John Peacock, have been placed in Group D alongside Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland. The squad includes players from various Premier League clubs, such as Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea, Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi of Arsenal, and Liverpool pair Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold. Arsenal's Chris Willock has been called up for the first time. England will open their campaign against Italy on May 7, followed by matches against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.

Manchester City is interested in signing 14-year-old Evangelos Patoulidis from Anderlecht. Patoulidis, a highly-regarded playmaker, has also attracted interest from Arsenal and Barcelona. He previously rejected a move to Barcelona's La Masia academy due to family's desire for him to continue his studies. City has held discussions with Anderlecht's chairman to agree on a compensation package, with manager Manuel Pellegrini aiming to secure the young talent as part of his future plans.

A transgender escort named Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old Mexican national, was found dead in a flat in Fulham, southwest London, on March 28. She died from injuries to the head and neck, and the cause of her death is under investigation. A 23-year-old man has been arrested in connection with her death and has been bailed, with a requirement to return for further questioning at a later date. Scotland Yard is appealing for anyone who may have had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death to come forward. Miss Santillan worked as an escort in London, Paris, and Miami. She had recently expressed her love for London and Paris on social media. The investigation is being led by Detective Chief Inspector Rebecca Reeves, who is urging anyone with information to come forward.

The passage describes a woman named Dawn, who has suffered seven miscarriages, being distressed after a friend, Jamie (who lives with Dawn and her partner), stole money set aside for a grave stone for one of her miscarried babies. The incident was discussed on The Jeremy Kyle show, where a lie detector test revealed Jamie's guilt. Jamie had initially denied taking the money, but a Facebook message he sent to Dawn during the journey to London, confessing to taking the money and blaming it on his girlfriend Carol, was later revealed. Dawn, who was planning to spend the money on a gravestone, felt betrayed and expressed her distress, bursting into tears and storming off the stage. She was later comforted by her partner, also named Jamie.

ISIS has released over 200 Yazidis, a persecuted minority group in northern Iraq, after Arab tribal leaders helped coordinate the release. The majority of those released were women and children, with the rest being ill or elderly. The reason for the release is unclear. The Yazidis, who are of Kurdish descent and practice a pre-Islamic religion, have long suffered persecution and were forced from their homes when ISIS overtook their towns last summer. ISIS's cruelty towards the Yazidis has been extraordinary, with reports of mass killings, enslavement, and rape of female captives. An international coalition, including the United States, has responded with airstrikes and humanitarian aid. Approximately 500,000 Yazidis live in northern Iraq, accounting for less than 1% of the country's population.

Harry Kane, a Tottenham striker, has had an exceptional season, breaking into the first team and the England side. He has scored 20 Premier League goals and is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season awards. A video titled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?' has been produced by Copa90, showcasing some of his best goals and celebrations, including his long-range strike against Chelsea and his debut goal for England. The awards ceremony is on Sunday, where Kane will compete against Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez for the top prize.

Jamie Carragher, a former Liverpool defender, believes Brendan Rodgers is still the right manager for Liverpool despite a third consecutive season without a trophy and a likely finish outside the top four. Carragher supports Rodgers' continued tenure at Anfield, stating that the team will aim to improve and win a trophy next season. Carragher himself received a Beacon Award for his community work in Merseyside, where he has provided coaching in eight schools in deprived areas through his 23 Foundation. Carragher emphasized his desire to help youngsters in his community and expressed his hope that his efforts will make a positive impact.

A four-year-old boy named James Hayward had his toy gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport. The toy, a plastic Nerf gun that fires sponge darts, was deemed a security risk by airport security. James was frisked and inspected thoroughly before being forced to hand over the toy. His father, Phil Hayward, described the security checks as "ludicrous" and criticized the staff's reaction. The family was traveling to Lanzarote and missed their flight due to the incident. After returning from their holiday, James was bought a replacement toy gun. East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience but defended their decision, stating that the safety and security of passengers is their priority and all regulations are set by the government. The hand luggage restrictions on all UK flights are set by the Department of Transport, and while there is no specific mention of models and makes of such "toy guns," the prohibited list does include "replica or model guns."

The passage describes a man named Rich, who lives in Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, and has posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife. Rich's advertisement outlines his personal details, including that he is athletic, heavily tattooed, and does not drink, smoke, or do drugs. He also owns property and makes good money. Rich's dream partner must be non-drinking and non-smoking, fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, good cook, great in bed, and enjoy the outdoors. The successful applicant would receive benefits such as accommodation, a company car, phone, and laptop. Rich also stated that former partners need not apply, and he is not shy of spending money on his partner. Daily Mail Australia attempted to contact Rich, but were unsuccessful.

The passage discusses a proposal by Football Association (FA) chairman Greg Dyke to increase the number of home-grown players in Premier League squads from eight to twelve, and to change the definition of 'home-grown' to mean having trained in England for three years before the age of 18. This proposal is facing opposition from the Premier League. Five former England managers - Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson, and Steve McClaren - have backed Dyke's call, warning that failure to implement these changes could result in England falling further behind other leading football nations and make it harder to win the World Cup. They also point out that the pool of English talent playing at the top level is shrinking, and that the emergence of young players such as Ross Barkley, Raheem Sterling, and Harry Kane provides signs of encouragement. However, they argue that these young players are not being offered enough opportunities.

The passage discusses the Poldark TV show and its latest addition, a new baby girl born to the character Demelza Poldark, played by Eleanor Tomlinson. The timeline of Demelza's pregnancy is questionable, as she goes from barely showing to eight months pregnant within a short timeframe in the show. Ross Poldark, played by Aidan Turner, is shown to be in love with Demelza, but it is mentioned that his heart seems to be off the market. The fast pace of pregnancies in the show has been noted by fans, who have commented on social media. The passage also mentions that Ross Poldark is a popular heartthrob among women.

Leicester City, currently bottom of the Barclays Premier League, has a slim chance of survival after two consecutive wins, including a 3-2 victory against West Brom. Jamie Vardy scored the injury-time winner in that match. Manager Nigel Pearson has urged the team to focus on their own performances and not be influenced by their relegation rivals. He emphasized that their future is in their own hands and they should concentrate on their own run-in to give themselves a realistic chance of survival. Pearson also warned against over-optimism, as one potential problem they may face.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara has set a new record for the longest migration of any mammal, traveling approximately 14,000 miles from Russia's Sakhalin Island to Baja, Mexico. During her journey, Varvara visited three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales, which suggests that some western gray whales might be eastern grays. This discovery could impact the estimated population of western gray whales, which is already critically low, with only about 150 believed to exist. The study's lead author, Bruce Mate, believes Varvara's long journey may provide insights into the whale's origins and the potential genetic similarities between eastern and western gray whales.

A landslide on Hokkaido Island's Shiretoko Peninsula caused approximately 1,000ft of seabed to rise up to 50ft above sea level overnight, creating a new stretch of coastline near Rausu. This unexpected event occurred without any noticeable sounds or tremors, according to local residents. The landmass, measuring around 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide, has marine organisms such as seaweed and sea urchins still attached to it. Authorities believe this event is different from earthquakes and is not related to the 7.8 magnitude earthquake that occurred in the Kathmandu Valley.

Gregory van der Wiel, a full back for Paris Saint-Germain, has denied rumors of his departure from the club in the summer. He recently had a disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc after being dropped, but Van der Wiel expressed his happiness at PSG, stating his love for the club, city, and teammates. He desires to sign a new contract and is ready to play whenever called upon. The Parisians are linked with Barcelona star Dani Alves, which could potentially lead to Van der Wiel being sold.

Carlos Tevez, a former Manchester City striker, has expressed his desire to return to his former club Boca Juniors in Argentina this summer. His contract with Juventus, where he is currently a player, runs until the end of the 2015-2016 season. However, Boca Juniors' president Daniel Angelici has stated that Tevez must terminate his contract with Juventus first before the move can be completed. Tevez has scored 17 goals this season for Juventus, making him the league's top scorer. Despite his contributions, Juventus have accepted his wish to leave and are already looking for potential replacements. Tevez has previously stated his intention to finish his career at Boca Juniors. His international manager, Tata Martino, has said that any potential move would not affect Tevez's Argentina future.

Pep Guardiola, manager of Bayern Munich, tore a hole in his trousers during a Champions League match against Porto, leading 5-0 at half-time and eventually winning 6-1. This incident occurred while Guardiola was experiencing high excitement. Bayern's victory allowed them to advance to the Champions League semi-finals, leaving their opponents, Porto, in a shell-shocked state. Guardiola joked about needing new trousers for the next match. The passage also mentions that Guardiola removed his suit blazer during the latter stages of the match, and includes images of Guardiola before and after the trouser rip.

A multi-vehicle crash occurred on Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, involving ten people, including four children. Three vehicles were involved in the pileup. A 40-year-old man, a 5-year-old boy, a 27-year-old woman, and a 6-year-old girl were seriously injured and flown to the Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane. Six others, including an infant, two young girls, and two females with minor injuries, were taken to Ipswich Hospital. The highway was closed for a few hours with diversions in place south of Fernvale, and earlier emergency crews had to free one person trapped in their vehicle.

The passage discusses two main topics: the acquisition of an Apple Watch by Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil and the potential of Jack Wilshere for Arsenal.

1. Mesut Ozil, a player for Arsenal, received an Apple Watch from a visit to an Apple store. He shared his excitement about the new gadget on Instagram, comparing it to the watch from the TV show Knight Rider. The watch will be available for general sale on Friday. Ozil is expected to play in Arsenal's upcoming match against Chelsea.

2. Jack Wilshere, another Arsenal midfielder, is expected to have a significant role in the team due to his skills in passing and linking up with teammates. However, his potential is hindered by his injury history, as he has struggled to stay fit for a full season in the past few years. Arsenal legend Ray Parlour believes Wilshere is the future of the club but questions whether he can stay fit for a full season without prolonged injuries.

Referee Mark Clattenburg, known for his controversial past, has been assigned to officiate the Manchester derby between United and City at Old Trafford. He has sent off three players from both teams this season, with two from United (Tyler Blackett and Luke Shaw). City captain Vincent Kompany is suspended for the match due to his dismissal during Belgium's Euro 2016 qualifier. The derby could decide the second place finish behind Chelsea, with United currently a point above City after their recent win over Crystal Palace. Assistants Simon Beck and Jake Collin, along with fourth official Jonathan Moss, will also be present for the match. Clattenburg is generally regarded as one of the Premier League's leading referees.

Bob Katter, a federal MP of Lebanese descent, has made a controversial statement on his party's website, accusing the Queensland Government of assuming that embattled MP Billy Gordon, who is of African descent, would resign after being accused of domestic violence and withholding his criminal history. Katter believes the Government treated Gordon like a 'little black puppet on a string'. The statement has received criticism on social media for the use of the term 'black puppet'. Katter has defended his statement, stating he used the term due to his personal experiences and his desire to call out racial overtones. He also compared the situation of Gordon to that of former independents Tony Windsor and Rob Oakeshott, suggesting they became 'puppets' for the government.

A 19-year-old girl named Dayna Dobias from Illinois, who was born with cerebral palsy, is using dance to challenge stereotypes and inspire others. She has created several videos, including one to Taylor Swift's Shake It Off, to counteract the belief that people with disabilities cannot do anything. Dayna has faced bullying and discrimination, but she hopes her videos will encourage people to think before judging and see her as just another person. She has also started doing motivational speaking at local schools. Despite being diagnosed with cerebral palsy, Dayna is able to drive, attend college, and do things like any other 19-year-old.

Orlando City, an MLS team coached by Adrian Heath, has expressed interest in signing Javier Hernandez, a Mexico international who is currently on loan at Real Madrid and has a tough time. Orlando City has a large Latin-American fanbase, and Hernandez would be a commercial draw. However, eight European clubs, including Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, and Inter Milan, are also interested in Hernandez. United is willing to sell Hernandez for around £8 million. Additionally, Manchester United has made a revised contract offer to Andreas Pereira, a 19-year-old midfielder who has attracted interest from Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, and Feyenoord if he does not agree terms at United. Pereira was on the bench against Aston Villa on Saturday.

In the provided passage, a car was set on fire at a 76 Station in South Los Angeles early on a Saturday morning. The incident occurred after a heated argument between the driver of the car (who remains unidentified) and at least three suspects. The suspects covered the driver's white Dodge Charger with gasoline and ignited it, despite there being two passengers inside. Fortunately, no one was injured during the fire. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as an arson, and the suspects are currently at large. Surveillance video of the incident is being used in the investigation. It is also reported that the suspects attempted to carjack the driver before the fire.

Charles Manuel, a chiropractor from Lamoni, southern Iowa, has surrendered his state license after admitting to exchanging services for sex and performing exorcisms on some patients. Despite these misdeeds, he has received high ratings for patient satisfaction on HealthGrades.com. The agreement requires Manuel to prove that the circumstances surrounding the revocation of his license no longer exist before he can practice chiropractic in Iowa again. This includes the bartering of sex for services and recommending that patients stop taking medication he prescribed. Manuel's practice was listed on a residential street in Lamoni, and he has received only three positive patient survey responses on HealthGrades.com, all of which gave him a perfect five out of five stars in patient satisfaction.

The passage describes an incident where a Russian SU-27 Flanker intercepted a U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance plane in international airspace north of Poland over the Baltic Sea. The U.S. crew considered the Russian pilot's actions as "unsafe and unprofessional" due to aggressive maneuvers and high speed. However, Russian state news agency Sputnik reported that the U.S. plane was flying towards the Russian border with its transponder switched off. The U.S. Pentagon and State Department plan to file a complaint through diplomatic channels with Russia. This is not the first time such an incident has occurred, as a year ago, a Russian jet flew within 100 feet of a RC-135U over the Sea of Okhotsk, which was also considered one of the most dangerous close passes in decades. Both Russian and U.S. aircraft often encounter each other in Northern Europe and the area between the Russian Far East and Alaska.

A sniper rifle belonging to an FBI agent was stolen from a hotel parking lot in Salt Lake City, Utah, just days before President Obama's visit. The rifle was secured properly in a hard case and attached to a truck safe with padlocks and chains. Police believe the thief broke the car's window, tied a rope around the rifle case's handle, and used another vehicle to pull the case through the window. The rifle has not been recovered, and the agent's gear bag, backpack, and some clothing were also stolen. The hotel where the agent was staying does not have surveillance cameras. The Secret Service was notified about the stolen rifle but did not comment on whether it prompted an increase in security. It is unknown if the thief specifically targeted the agent's car.

In July 2012, Luigi Costa, aged 71, is accused of murdering his elderly neighbor Terrence Freebody in Red Hill, Canberra. The murder allegedly occurred in the dining room of Freebody's home. Costa is believed to have stomped on Freebody's head, cut his throat, and stabbed him multiple times.

Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen examined Costa after the incident and concluded that Costa was likely suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse, which may have contributed to his confused state of mind during the murder. Evidence supporting this includes the fluctuating mood indicated by the triple 0 calls Costa made during the incident and the trail of faeces leading from the crime scene to the toilet.

Prosecutor Shane Drumgold suggested that Costa may have feigned his failing memory during his interview with Professor Mullen, but Mullen denied these claims. The jury is considering whether Costa's unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven, as a not guilty verdict may be returned if his mental state is found to be unstable.

In the passage, Everton manager Roberto Martinez defends Ross Barkley's decision to take a penalty against Burnley, despite Leighton Baines' proven record of success from the spot. Barkley, who has scored 15 penalties from 16 attempts in the Premier League, missed the penalty, but Everton went on to win 1-0, with Mirallas scoring the only goal. Martinez argued that Barkley was within his rights to take the penalty and praised his responsibility, stating that he encourages multiple players to take penalties based on their feelings in the moment. Baines, who was on the pitch, was reportedly happy to give Barkley the responsibility. The passage also mentions that if Romelu Lukaku had been on the pitch, he would have taken the penalty instead.

The passage describes a murder-suicide incident that occurred on a cruise ship, ms Ryndam, operated by Holland America Line. The incident took place in a stateroom on the ship at 11:30 a.m. on Thursday. The authorities, including the FBI, were notified and are currently investigating the incident. The ship departed from Tampa, Florida, on March 29 and is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The cleaning staff on the ship discovered the deceased passengers after knocking on the cabin's door. The official determination of what occurred will be made by the authorities.

Patrick Kluivert, a former Holland forward and assistant coach, has successfully led Curacao, a Caribbean island team, to the second qualifying round for the 2018 World Cup. This advancement was achieved after a 2-2 draw in the second-leg match against Montserrat, resulting in a 4-3 aggregate win. The team had previously won 2-1 in their first match. Curacao will face Cuba in the next round, on June 8 and 16. Kluivert, who is of Curacaoan descent, was a semi-finalist in the 1998 World Cup as a player and last year as an assistant coach to Louis van Gaal.

Esteban Cambiasso, a former Inter Milan player with an impressive trophy count, has joined Leicester City in the English Premier League. Currently in a relegation battle, Cambiasso believes keeping Leicester in the Premier League would be as significant as winning a trophy. Despite not winning a game since January, he remains optimistic about their chances against West Ham United and believes they can avoid relegation. Cambiasso joined Leicester in the summer after a decade in Italy and has quickly become a key player. His current contract expires at the end of the season, but he is happy in the East Midlands and may choose to stay beyond his one-year deal.

The passage describes a 23-year-old mother named Gemma who is at risk of being banned from seeing her two children under five by her mother Debbie due to Gemma's excessive drinking, partying, and suspected theft. Debbie, who has been caring for the children since they were four months old, claims that Gemma stole an iPad and sold it to fund her lifestyle. Although Gemma denies stealing the device, she admits to stealing from her mother in the past. Debbie, who appeared on The Jeremy Kyle Show with Gemma, is preparing to ban Gemma from her home and from seeing the children because she can't trust her not to steal from them. Gemma is unemployed and prefers drinking and partying over work and motherhood, according to her mother. The children call Debbie "mum" instead of grandma.

In the given passage, Eden Hazard scored the opening goal for Chelsea against Manchester United at Stamford Bridge. The pundits on Sky Sports, including Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp, and Graeme Souness, agreed during their half-time analysis that John Terry had committed a foul on Radamel Falcao during the build-up to the goal. Terry's strong challenge from behind on Falcao, which sent the United striker tumbling to the ground, led to a loose ball that was picked up by Cesc Fabregas, starting the scoring move. The pundits felt that the foul on Falcao should have resulted in a stoppage of play.

Hillary Scott, co-lead singer of Lady Antebellum, experienced a tour bus fire on Interstate 30 near Dallas, Texas. The fire started after a rear tire blew out. Everyone on board, including Scott, her husband, the tour manager, and the driver, were safely evacuated. The fire destroyed most of the bus's contents, but Scott's Bible was spared. The band's two other members were not on the bus at the time. Lady Antebellum is scheduled to perform at the 50th Academy of Country Music Awards on Sunday in Arlington, Texas.

The passage discusses two different applications of space lasers, one proposed by Dr Adrian Quarterman of Dundee University and the other by researchers at the Riken research institute in Tokyo. Dr Quarterman's idea is to use space lasers to convert sunlight into energy for powering homes, particularly in Scotland and disaster-hit areas. The lasers would be mounted on satellites covered in mirrors to harvest sunlight and convert it into laser light, which would then be used to boost the energy received by solar panels on Earth. Initial trials in Scotland have been successful, and Dr Quarterman plans to move the trials to Portugal.

The Tokyo researchers propose a laser system to be attached to the International Space Station (ISS) for shooting down pieces of debris in Earth orbit. This system would use a telescope already mounted on the ISS to find and target small pieces of debris up to 62 miles away. Powerful pulses from the laser would then push the debris into Earth’s atmosphere, where it would burn up. However, neither of these laser systems would be powerful enough to be turned into weapons. Dr Quarterman has acknowledged concerns about who is in control of his satellites.

A predatory, convicted paedophile named Stephen Munden, 54, with an obsession for young girls, has gone missing from a psychiatric unit after vanishing on Tuesday evening. He was last seen leaving a hospital near Hook, Hampshire. Munden was detained under the Mental Health Act following his sentence last August for sexually touching a child under the age of 13. He was also convicted of ten unrelated offenses of possessing or attempting to possess indecent images of children. Munden is described as about 5ft 8ins tall, of a heavy build, and has dark hair. Officers believe he may have shaved off his beard before leaving the hospital. A manhunt has been launched to find Munden, and anyone with information about his whereabouts is urged to contact the authorities.

In the provided passage, V. Stiviano, a former companion of Donald Sterling, was ordered by a Los Angeles judge to return over $2.6 million in gifts she received from Sterling. This was after Sterling's wife, Rochelle "Shelly" Sterling, sued Stiviano, accusing her of targeting wealthy older men. The gifts included luxury cars, a duplex, and various other items, some of which were quite unusual such as a $391 Easter bunny costume, a $299 two-speed blender, and a $12 lace thong.

Donald Sterling's downfall was triggered by an audio recording where he was heard arguing with Stiviano about her posting pictures with African-Americans, including basketball legend Magic Johnson, on social media. He was banned from the NBA, fined $2.5 million, and had his ownership rights in the Los Angeles Clippers franchise terminated.

Thierry Henry, a former Arsenal player and current Sky Sports pundit, has criticized Arsenal's recent transfer dealings and urged them to sign four top players: a goalkeeper, center back, defensive midfielder, and a top-quality striker. Henry believes these signings are necessary for Arsenal to have a chance at winning the Barclays Premier League title. He also expressed doubts about Olivier Giroud's ability to lead Arsenal to the title, despite Giroud scoring 14 league goals this season. Arsenal is currently third in the Premier League, level on points with Manchester City but with a game in hand.

A young woman, who was subjected to years of abuse by Bega Cheese boss Maurice Van Ryn, has shared the severe impact his actions had on her life. The abuse started when she was a child, and she didn't understand it was wrong at the time. Van Ryn has pleaded guilty to 12 sex offences, including persistent sexual abuse of a child, the most serious charge. The woman has expressed fear for her future relationships, feeling that Van Ryn has taken away her right to share her body with someone for the first time. She has also struggled with depression since she was 14, and has been hospitalized for self-harm and attempted suicide. The hearing continues, and readers seeking support and information about suicide prevention can contact Lifeline on 13 11 14.

Serge Gnabry, a 19-year-old midfielder for Arsenal, is recovering from a serious knee injury that has kept him out for over a year. He played 90 minutes for Arsenal's Under-21 team against Reading on Monday, marking his return to play. Gnabry impressed for Arsenal last season before his progress was halted by the injury. He is now over his injury concerns and is looking forward to his next game.

A 23-year-old accountant named Jacob Phillips died after falling down a 70ft cliff in Penarth, South Wales. He ran from a taxi to avoid paying the fare during a night out with friends in December. The taxi driver, Dave Sidaway, pursued him but was unaware of the danger. Phillips was found dead at the end of the disused Northern Promenade, a rocky area at the base of the cliff, the next day by a dog walker. The inquest revealed that Phillips had run off into the dark and fell down the cliff, likely due to disorientation and not knowing the danger. He had been out drinking in Cardiff before catching a taxi with friends Padraig Crowley and Rory Robinson. The coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death. Phillips worked for Pretty Green, a clothing label run by Oasis star Liam Gallagher, and had grown up in Barry, South Wales, before studying accountancy at the University of Birmingham. He had returned to Wales for Christmas and was staying with his mother in the upmarket Cowbridge area. The friends had planned to stay at a friend's house but didn't

The passage describes a passport delay fiasco that occurred last summer, affecting thousands of holidaymakers. Despite the Passport Office making a £42 million profit during this chaos, only a small number of affected individuals received compensation. The Passport Office approved 2,191 compensation applications between April last year and January this year, totaling £203,066. The biggest single payout was £5,463, while the lowest was £1. Ministers refused to give a blanket refund to those who had to pay extra to get their travel documents rushed through, and even to some who missed out on trips. The Passport Office also handed out £1.8 million in bonuses to managers in 2013-14, with the highest reward being £3,500. Keith Vaz, chairman of the Home Affairs Committee, led the calls for compensation and was "astonished" to learn just 2,191 compensation applications were approved.

The passage describes a semi-detached house in Horfield, Bristol, that has remained unchanged since the 1930s and is now up for sale. The house, which has a guide price of between £200,000 and £250,000, features original stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, a retro kitchen and bathroom, wood-panelled hallway, and vintage cupboards. The bathroom, in particular, is eye-catching with its mint and black color scheme, original tiles, wooden floor, yellow wallpaper, and green sink. The house also has a brick open-face fire, a dated kitchen sink, and original tins of produce from the past on a hallway shelf. While some features have been upgraded, such as double glazing, the potential cost of renovations could deter developers. The house is a collector's or antique lover's paradise and could make a perfect family home for those with a passion for antiques. The historic house will be auctioned on April 30 at the County Ground in Bristol.

Colin Kaepernick started his professional career as a backup to Alex Smith in the San Francisco 49ers. After Smith suffered a concussion in the middle of the 2012 season, Kaepernick became the team's starter. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, but they lost to the Baltimore Ravens.
The passage describes "Soul Food," a 1997 American comedy-drama film. The film was produced by Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds, Tracey Edmonds, and Robert Teitel, and was released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice, born in New Orleans, lived in various places including Texas and San Francisco. The passage also describes Route 495, a 3.45-mile freeway in Hudson County, New Jersey. This route connects the New Jersey Turnpike (I-95) at exits 16E and 17 in Secaucus to New York State Route 495 inside the Lincoln Tunnel in Weehawken, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language terrestrial television network, owned by Comcast through NBCUniversal division, NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises.

Damon Albarn, raised in Leytonstone, East London, and Colchester, Essex, attended Stanway School where he met Graham Coxon and formed the band Blur. Their debut album, Leisure, was released in 1991 to mixed reviews. Influenced by alternative rock, trip hop, hip hop, electronica, dub, reggae, and pop music, Blur released their self-titled album in 2001 to worldwide success. Albarn's debut solo studio album, Everyday Robots, co-produced by Richard Russell, was released on April 28, 2014. It featured collaborations with Brian Eno, Natasha Khan, the Leytonstone City Pentecostal Mission Church Choir, and samples from Lord Buckley's rants.
Mogadishu, also known as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. It houses many important national institutions, making it the central hub of the country.
The passage describes "Happiness in Slavery" as a song by the American industrial rock band Nine Inch Nails, which appears on their debut extended play (EP), titled Broken, released in 1992.
Andrew Kevin Walker is an American BAFTA-nominated screenwriter, born on August 14, 1964.

The passage describes two separate stories:

1. The 2007 film 'Shooter' features Mark Wahlberg as Bob Lee Swagger, a Force Recon veteran who is framed for murder by a rogue secret private military company unit.

2. The TV series 'Shooter' stars Ryan Phillippe as Bob Lee Swagger, an expert marksman living in exile. He is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president.
"House, M.D." is an American television medical drama that aired on Fox for eight seasons from November 16, 2004, to May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson, a notorious figure, was convicted of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder in 1971 for the deaths of seven individuals: Abigail Ann Folger, Wojciech Frykowski, Steven Earl Parent, Sharon Tate Polanski, Jay Sebring, Leno La Bianca, and Rosemary La Bianca. The most notable victim was actress Sharon Tate. These murders were committed by members of his group at his instruction. Additionally, Manson received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald "Shorty" Shea. Post his charges, songs written and performed by him were released commercially.

Sean Justin Penn, born on August 17, 1960, is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He started his acting career with a brief appearance in "Little House on the Prairie" in 1974, directed by his father Leo Penn. Penn gained critical attention in the 1980s with roles in films like "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" (1982), "At Close Range" (1986), "State of Grace" (1990), and "Carlito's Way" (1993). He gained prominence as a leading actor with the drama "Dead Man Walking" (1995), earning his first Academy Award nomination and the Best Actor Award at the Berlin Film Festival. Penn received two more Oscar nominations for "Sweet and Lowdown" (1999) and "I Am Sam" (2001). He won his first Academy Award for Best Actor in 2003 for "Mystic River" and a second one in 2008 for "Milk".

Sir Donald Bradman, known as "The Don," was an Australian cricketer, considered the greatest batsman in history. He played cricket from 1928 to 1948 and, after retirement, continued to contribute to the sport through administration, selection, and writing for three decades.

Christopher Hogwood, a renowned conductor and early-music movement exponent, passed away at his home in Cambridge after a prolonged illness. He was a founder of the Academy of Ancient Music (AAM) in 1973, serving as its director for over 30 years and leading it across six continents. The AAM made more than 200 CDs, including the first-ever complete cycle of Mozart symphonies on period instruments. Hogwood studied at Cambridge University and worked with various leading orchestras worldwide. He was also a tutor at Harvard University, honorary professor of music at the University of Cambridge, and a professor-at-large at Cornell University in the US. Known for his generosity and academic prowess, Hogwood will be missed by many in the music industry.
